intro: Orychophragmus violaceus var. variegatus, commonly known as the variegated Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It is characterized by its striking variegated leaves with white and green patterns, and its clusters of violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. The species belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes other bellflower species.
